definition: insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen

sentences.english: The moonlight is still quiet, only a dim.
sentences.chinese: 月光依舊是清幽，只是多了一抹黯淡。

sentences.english: Complain not, no matter how bleak it seems.
sentences.chinese: 不要怨天尤人，無論現在看來是怎麼地黯淡淒涼。

sentences.english: If love is sadden then let the memory be refulgent .
sentences.chinese: 如果愛情黯淡，就讓回憶燦爛。

sentences.english: Uncertainty darkens the future of radio and television.
sentences.chinese: 不定因素使無線電和電視的前途黯淡。

sentences.english: The headwaiter of restaurant ranks the first because of the dark future .
sentences.chinese: 餐廳領班排名第一，因爲前景黯淡。

sentences.english: Intentionally frayed or distressed jeans distress him.
sentences.chinese: 故意磨損或顏色黯淡的牛仔褲會讓他很苦惱。

sentences.english: It’s not really the way you’re supposed to act here.” The upshot is that she feels her prospects of remarriage are dim.
sentences.chinese: 現實是，她感覺她再婚的前景黯淡無光。

sentences.english: Sky gradually dim down, but the waves are even more ferocious.
sentences.chinese: 天色漸漸黯淡下來，然而海浪卻更加兇猛。

sentences.english: There is a glimmer of hope among the bleak assessment.
sentences.chinese: 這份黯淡的評估中，我們還能看到一線希望。

sentences.english: When we met in the street the houses had grown somber.
sentences.chinese: 大夥兒在街上碰頭時，四周的房子都已黯淡下來。
索馬里的未來黯淡無光。

sentences.english: Then, just as suddenly, it faded.
sentences.chinese: 爾後突然之間它黯淡下來。

sentences.english: The more colors you mix together the muddier they will get.
sentences.chinese: 混在一起的顏色越多就越污濁黯淡。

sentences.english: I know not what vent-hole daylight habitually illumined his soul.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道是怎樣一種黯淡的光經常照着他的心。

sentences.english: Domplain not, no matter how bleak it seems.
sentences.chinese: 不要怨天恨地，不管此刻看來是怎麼地黯淡苦楚。

definition: light/beam of light/gleam of light/light reflected from an object
